title: Computer Vision - Mid-Unit Survey for Teachers

elements.name: survey_preamble_header_and_text
elements.html:
Welcome to Code.org's Computer Vision - Mid-Unit Survey

Code.org relies on surveys as a crucial tool to remain connected to teachers, and to give you the opportunity to provide feedback about your experience teaching our curriculum.

The purpose of this survey is to understand better who our teachers are, their motivation to teach Code.org's Computer Vision module, and their previous experience with this content and tools. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org to improve our curriculum and programs.

This survey should take less than 5 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

elements.name: curriculum_perceptions
elements.html:
Your Perceptions About the Computer Vision Unit

Please share with us a little bit about your thoughts on Code.org's Computer Vision curriculum so far.

elements.title: Is teaching with Code.org's Computer Vision unit effective for your students to learn computer vision and AI concepts?

elements.title: How confident do you feel in your ability to teach the remaining content of the unit?

elements.name: nps_value
elements.title: Based on your experience thus far, how likely are you to recommend this unit to other teachers?

elements.name: module_challenges
elements.title: What challenges do you anticipate in teaching this unit?

choices.text: Lack of student interest or motivation.
Difficulty in developing my own understanding or teaching complex concepts.
Time constraints within the academic calendar.
Managing diverse learning speeds and styles within the classroom.

elements.name: additional_supports
elements.title: What additional support or resources, if any, do you need at this point in the unit?

choices.text: More detailed lesson plans or guides.
Extra resources for students struggling with the content.

elements.title: Please describe what other supports or resources would be helpful for teaching this unit?
